movie_title: Disability in music and theatre   ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: The UK's Equality Act of 2010 guaranteed the rights of disabled people to equal access to education,

vocabulary.definition: made specially for one person in particular
vocabulary.example: The tailor created a bespoke suit for the customer.

vocabulary.definition: having dyslexia, a condition making it difficult to spell, read, or write
vocabulary.example: As a dyslexic student, he uses special tools to help with reading.

vocabulary.definition: to make many copies of something cheaply in a factory
vocabulary.example: The company decided to mass produce the popular toy to meet the high demand.

vocabulary.definition: including all types of people and not excluding any group
vocabulary.example: The school promotes an inclusive environment where every student feels welcome.

vocabulary.definition: the quality of being easy to approach, enter, use, or understand
vocabulary.example: The new building design focuses on accessibility for people with disabilities.

vocabulary.definition: use of different colors to represent different parts or functions
vocabulary.example: The map was color-coded to show different types of attractions in the city.
